betonquest.v1.event.cancel.description: クエストキャンセラーに設定されているクエストをキャンセル。
betonquest.v1.event.cancel.mandatory.can: `キャンセル:` セクションにて設定されているキャンセラー
betonquest.v1.event.chat.description: 指定したメッセージをプレイヤー出力にする
betonquest.v1.event.chestclear.descripti: Removes all items from a chest at specified location.
betonquest.v1.event.chestgive.descriptio: Puts items in a chest at specified location.
betonquest.v1.event.chesttake.descriptio: Removes items from a chest at specified location.
betonquest.v1.event.clear.description: Removes (instead of kills) all specified mobs from the specified area.
The name of the mob which should be removed
betonquest.v1.event.clear.optional.marke: Remove only mobs that with the same mark using the spawn mob event
betonquest.v1.event.compass.description: Adds or removes a compass destination for the player.
betonquest.v1.event.compass.mandatory.co: A name defined in the `compass` section
betonquest.v1.event.command.description: Runs specified command from the console.
betonquest.v1.event.conversation.descrip: Starts a conversation with the player.
betonquest.v1.event.damage.description: Damages the player by specified amount of damage.
betonquest.v1.event.deletepoint.descript: Clear all player points in a specified category.
betonquest.v1.event.door.description: Opens and closes doors, trapdoors and fence gates.
betonquest.v1.event.deleffect.descriptio: Removes the specified potion effects from the player.
betonquest.v1.event.effect.description: Adds a specified potion effect to player.
betonquest.v1.event.effect.mandatory.dur: How long the effect will last in seconds
betonquest.v1.event.effect.optional.ambi: Make potion particles appear more invisible (just like beacon effects)
betonquest.v1.event.effect.optional.noic: Hide the icon from user UI
betonquest.v1.event.folder.optional.dela: The delay before the folder starts executing it's events
betonquest.v1.event.folder.optional.peri: The interval between each event of the folder
betonquest.v1.event.folder.optional.rand: Number of events to be randomly picked
betonquest.v1.event.folder.optional.canc: Terminates the remaining events execution when the player disconnected
betonquest.v1.event.give.optional.notify: Display a message to the player about receiving items
betonquest.v1.event.givejournal.descript: Gives the player his journal. Same as /j command.
betonquest.v1.event.globalpoint.descript: Manipulates points in a global category. Same as the normal point event. These global categories are player independent.
betonquest.v1.event.globalpoint.mandator: Amount to change, could be multiply
betonquest.v1.event.globalpoint.optional: Display a message to the player about the change
betonquest.v1.event.globaltag.descriptio: Sets tag globally for all players.
betonquest.v1.event.if.description: Checks a condition then runs the first or second event.
betonquest.v1.event.journal.description: Adds, deletes an entry to/from a player's journal, or refreshes it.
betonquest.v1.event.journal.mandatory.jo: Leave it blank if you selected "Update"
betonquest.v1.event.killmob.description: Kills all mobs of given type at the location.
betonquest.v1.event.killmob.optional.nam: The name of the mob which should get killed
betonquest.v1.event.killmob.optional.mar: Kill only mobs that with the same mark using the spawn mob event
betonquest.v1.event.language.description: Changes player's language to the specified one.
betonquest.v1.event.lightning.descriptio: Strikes a lightning at given location.
betonquest.v1.event.notify.optional.cate: Will load all settings from that Notification Category
betonquest.v1.event.notifyall.descriptio: Send notifications to all online players.
betonquest.v1.event.notifyall.optional.c: Will load all settings from that Notification Category
betonquest.v1.event.objective.descriptio: Adds, removes or completes the specified objective(s).
betonquest.v1.event.opsudo.description: Fires a command as the player, with temporary OP permissions.
betonquest.v1.event.party.description: Runs events on every player in the party.
betonquest.v1.event.party.mandatory.dist: The coverage distance from the player whom triggers this event
betonquest.v1.event.party.mandatory.cond: Party members will be selected with these conditions
betonquest.v1.event.pickrandom.descripti: Pcks one (or multiple) events then runs it.
The maximum number of events to be executed
betonquest.v1.event.point.mandatory.amou: Amount to change, could be multiply
betonquest.v1.event.point.optional.notif: Display a message to the player about the change
betonquest.v1.event.run.description:
Specify multiple instructions in one, long instruction.
Actual instruction need to be specified, not an event name. Don't use conditions here, it behaves strangely.
betonquest.v1.event.run.mandatory.eventI: Actual instruction need to be specified, not an event name.
betonquest.v1.event.score.mandatory.name: Name
Name of the scoreboard objective
betonquest.v1.event.score.mandatory.amou: Amount to change, could be multiply
betonquest.v1.event.setblock.description: Changes the block at the given position.
betonquest.v1.event.setblock.optional.ig: Deactivate the physics of the block
betonquest.v1.event.spawn.description: Spawns specified amount of mobs of given type at the location.
The name of the mobs to be spawned
betonquest.v1.event.spawn.optional.marke: Add an invincible mark onto the spawned mobs
betonquest.v1.event.spawn.optional.h.too: Equip the mob with a helmet
betonquest.v1.event.spawn.optional.c.too: Equip the mob with a chestplate
betonquest.v1.event.spawn.optional.b.too: Equip the mob with a boots
betonquest.v1.event.spawn.optional.m.too: Equip the mob with an item on the main hand
betonquest.v1.event.spawn.optional.o.too: Equip the mob with an item on the off hand
betonquest.v1.event.spawn.optional.drops: Items to be dropped when killed
betonquest.v1.event.sudo.description: Fires a command as the player.
betonquest.v1.event.take.description: Removes items from the player's inventory, armor slots or backpack.
betonquest.v1.event.take.optional.invOrd: Will check these locations with order. Posible values: Backpack, Inventory, Offhand, Armor
betonquest.v1.event.take.optional.notify: Display a message to the player about loosing items
betonquest.v1.event.time.description:
Changes the time of the world.
  • `2.75` - Set to 2:45 AM
  • `+2.75` - Add 2.75 hour from now
  • `-2.75` - Subtract 2.75 hour from now
betonquest.v1.event.time.mandatory.hours: How many hours to be change. 1.25 hours = 1 hour + 15 min
The world name to be changed e.g. world
betonquest.v1.event.teleport.description: Teleports the player to the specified location.
betonquest.v1.event.variable.description: Changes a custom variable's value stored in a `variable` objective. Note that the player must have a `variable` objective started first for this event to have any effects.
betonquest.v1.event.variable.mandatory.v: The `variable` Objective' Name which you want to store the variable onto. You must define this Objective in you Objective list first.
betonquest.v1.event.weather.description: Sets the weather in the world the player is currently in.
betonquest.v1.event.experience.mandatory: amount to change depends on the Modification types
Add / remove levels instead of experience points
betonquest.v1.condition.advancement.desc: Does the player have a specified advancement?
betonquest.v1.condition.and.description: Checks if every conditions are met.
betonquest.v1.condition.and.mandatory.co: The conditions that must be met
betonquest.v1.condition.armor.descriptio: Does the player wearing an specified armor?
betonquest.v1.condition.biome.descriptio: Does the player inside a specific biome?
betonquest.v1.condition.check.descriptio: Define list of specific conditions, and check if the are all met.
betonquest.v1.condition.chestitem.descri: Does a chest have specific items?
betonquest.v1.condition.conversation.des: Does the player could begin a specified conversation? It checks the conversation's start options to see if any of them return true.
betonquest.v1.condition.effect.descripti: Does the player has an active potion effect?
betonquest.v1.condition.empty.descriptio: Does the player's inventory have enough empty slots?
betonquest.v1.condition.empty.optional.e: The player should have exact number of slots and no more
betonquest.v1.condition.entities.descrip: Are there any specified amount of mobs in an area?
betonquest.v1.condition.entities.mandato: A radius around location where the mobs must be
betonquest.v1.condition.entities.optiona: Should the mobs have the same mark from the spawn mob event?
betonquest.v1.condition.experience.descr: Does the player have the specified amount of experience levels?
betonquest.v1.condition.experience.optio: Unit in level instead of experience point?
betonquest.v1.condition.facing.descripti: Where does the player is looking at?
betonquest.v1.condition.facing.mandatory: Up and down start at a pitch of 60°
betonquest.v1.condition.gamemode.descrip: Is the the player in a specified game mode?
betonquest.v1.condition.gamemode.mandato: What game mode the player should be?
betonquest.v1.condition.globalpoint.desc: Is the global point equal or greater than a specified value?
betonquest.v1.condition.globalpoint.opti: The Global Point should have exact number of points and no more
betonquest.v1.condition.hand.description: Is the player holding a specific item on hand?
betonquest.v1.condition.health.descripti: Does the player have equal or more health than specified amount?
betonquest.v1.condition.health.mandatory: Health level could be a decimal
betonquest.v1.condition.height.descripti: Does the player stand BELOW specific height?
betonquest.v1.condition.height.mandatory: Height Y could be a decimal
betonquest.v1.condition.item.description: Does the player have all the specified items in inventory?
betonquest.v1.condition.journal.descript: Does the player have a specified entry in his/her journal?
betonquest.v1.condition.journal.mandator: An internal name of the entry defined in the `journal` section
betonquest.v1.condition.location.descrip: Does the player stand within a specified location?
betonquest.v1.condition.looking.descript: Does the player looking at a block? You must specified either a Location or Type of Block.
betonquest.v1.condition.looking.optional: The target block is not allowed to have more BlockStates than specified
betonquest.v1.condition.mooncycle.descri: Is the phase of the moon the same as specified?
betonquest.v1.condition.objective.descri: Does the player have an active objective?
betonquest.v1.condition.or.description: Checks if any one condition is met.
betonquest.v1.condition.partialdate.desc: Does the current date match a given pattern?
betonquest.v1.condition.partialdate.opti: The day of the month, e.g. 2 means 2nd of every month
The month of the year, e.g. 2-4 means from February to April
The coverage distance from the player whom triggers this condition
Party member will be selected with these conditions
betonquest.v1.condition.party.optional.e: The conditions that must be met by all party members
betonquest.v1.condition.party.optional.a: The conditions that only need to be met by one party member
betonquest.v1.condition.party.optional.c: Minimun amount of members in the party
betonquest.v1.condition.permission.descr: Does the player have a specific permission node?
betonquest.v1.condition.point.descriptio: Does the player have enough points?
betonquest.v1.condition.point.optional.e: The player should have exact number of points and no more
betonquest.v1.condition.riding.descripti: Is the player riding an entity?
betonquest.v1.condition.random.mandatory: e.g. 12-100 means 12 out of 100 times return true
betonquest.v1.condition.rating.descripti: Is the armor have enough protection (armor icons) the plaryer wearing?
betonquest.v1.condition.rating.mandatory: Increament by 1, equals to 0.5 armor icon in-game
betonquest.v1.condition.realtime.descrip: Is the current real-world's time within a range?
betonquest.v1.condition.score.descriptio: Does the playe gained enough score in a specified objective on a scoreboard?
betonquest.v1.condition.tag.description: Does the player have a specified tag?
betonquest.v1.condition.testforblock.des: Is there a specific block on a location?
betonquest.v1.condition.testforblock.opt: The target block is not allowed to have more BlockStates than specified
betonquest.v1.condition.time.description: Is the in-game time within a specific range?
betonquest.v1.condition.variable.descrip: Is a variable match a regular expression?
betonquest.v1.condition.weather.descript: Is the weather matched? Note that you need to use `/weather` to change the weather for this to take effects, NOT `/toggledownfall`.
betonquest.v1.condition.world.descriptio: Is the player staying in a specified world?
betonquest.v1.objective.*.optional.event: Events to be run if this objective is fulfilled
betonquest.v1.objective.action.descripti: Completes when the player clicks on the given block type.
The target block is not allowed to have more BlockStates than specified
Should the clikc, e.g. left click hit mobs, be cancelled?
betonquest.v1.objective.arrow.descriptio: The player needs to shoot an arrow into the target.
A radius around location where the arrow must land, should be small
betonquest.v1.objective.block.descriptio: The player must break or place the specified amount of blocks.
betonquest.v1.objective.block.optional.e: The target block is not allowed to have more BlockStates than specified
betonquest.v1.objective.block.optional.n: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v1.objective.breed.descriptio: The player must breed a type of animals for certain amounts.
betonquest.v1.objective.breed.optional.n: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective
betonquest.v1.objective.chestput.descrip: The player must put the specified items in a specified chest.
betonquest.v1.objective.chestput.optiona: Do not remove the items from chest when objective completed
betonquest.v1.objective.consume.descript: The player must eat the specified foods, or drink the specified potion.
betonquest.v1.objective.craft.descriptio: The player must craft specified items.
betonquest.v1.objective.craft.optional.n: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v1.objective.enchant.descript: The player must enchant the specified quest item with a specified enchantment.
betonquest.v1.objective.experience.descr: The player must reach the specified amount of experience levels.
betonquest.v1.objective.experience.optio: Unit in level instead of experience point?
betonquest.v1.objective.delay.descriptio: The player must wait for certain amount of time, including offline. Unit defaults to "minutes".
betonquest.v1.objective.delay.optional.i: The interval in which the objective checks if the time is up. Measured in ticks. Low values cost more performance but make the objective preciser.
betonquest.v1.objective.die.description: The player must die with conditions.
betonquest.v1.objective.fish.description: The player must catch something with the fishing rod. The "fish" could be any item.
betonquest.v1.objective.fish.mandatory.i: The item that must be caught
betonquest.v1.objective.fish.optional.no: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v1.objective.interact.descrip: The player must click on an entity.
betonquest.v1.objective.interact.mandato: How many UNIQUE mobs that need to be cliked (not the same mob)
betonquest.v1.objective.interact.optiona: The name of the mob to be clicked
If the mob is a player, the real name of the player to be clicked
Should the mobs have the same mark from the spawn mob event?
Should the clikc, e.g. left click hit mobs, be cancelled?
Where the click should be happened
Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v1.objective.kill.description: The player needs to kill another players.
betonquest.v1.objective.kill.mandatory.a: How many players that need to be killed
betonquest.v1.objective.kill.optional.na: The name of the player to be killed
betonquest.v1.objective.kill.optional.re: Conditions that need to be satisfied by the players whom are going to be killed, e.g. tag_team_b
betonquest.v1.objective.kill.optional.no: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v1.objective.location.descrip: The player must move into a specified range of a location.
betonquest.v1.objective.location.mandato: A radius around location where the player must be
betonquest.v1.objective.login.descriptio: The player simply needs to login to the server.
betonquest.v1.objective.logout.descripti: The player simply needs to leave the server.
betonquest.v1.objective.password.descrip:
The player has to write a certain password in chat.
This is what the player has to type in chat:
Solution: The Cake is a lie!
betonquest.v1.objective.password.optiona: List of events to be executed when password incorrect
betonquest.v1.objective.pickup.descripti: The player needs to pickup the specified amount of items.
Number of items to be picked up, in total.
Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective
betonquest.v1.objective.mobkill.descript: The player must kill the specified amount of entities.
betonquest.v1.objective.mobkill.mandator: Number of mobs to be killed
betonquest.v1.objective.mobkill.optional: The name of the mob to be killed
Should the mobs have the same mark from the spawn mob event?
Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v1.objective.brew.description: The player needs to brew specified amount of specified potions.
betonquest.v1.objective.brew.optional.no: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v1.objective.shear.descriptio: The player has to shear specified amount of sheep.
betonquest.v1.objective.shear.optional.n: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v1.objective.smelt.descriptio: The player must smelt the specified item.
The item that must be smelt
Number of items to be smelt
betonquest.v1.objective.smelt.optional.n: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v1.objective.step.description: The player has to step on a pressure plate at a given location. The type of plate does not matter.
betonquest.v1.objective.tame.description: The player must tame some amount of mobs.
betonquest.v1.objective.jump.description:
The player must jump.
This feature requires Paper.
betonquest.v1.objective.riding.descripti: The player must ride a specific entitiy
betonquest.v1.objective.variable.descrip:
tores custom variables. It also allows the player to set custom variables typed in chat with format "key: value".
For more details, please refer to the documentation.
betonquest.v1.objective.variable.optiona: Prevent players from changing variables through chat. All variales must be changed with a `variable` Event.
betonquest.v2.event.cancel.description: Cancel a quest predefined in a Quest Canceler.
betonquest.v2.event.cancel.mandatory.can: A canceler name predefined in the package's `cancel:` section
betonquest.v2.event.burn.mandatory.durat: The duration the player will burn (in seconds)
betonquest.v2.event.cancelconversation.d: Cancels the active conversation of the player.
betonquest.v2.event.chat.description: Send the given message as the player.
betonquest.v2.event.chestclear.descripti: Removes all items from a chest at specified location.
betonquest.v2.event.chestgive.descriptio: Puts items in a chest at specified location.
betonquest.v2.event.chesttake.descriptio: Removes items from a chest at specified location.
betonquest.v2.event.compass.description: Adds or removes a compass destination for the player.
betonquest.v2.event.compass.mandatory.co: A name predefined in the `compass:` section
betonquest.v2.event.command.description: Runs specified command from the console.
betonquest.v2.event.conversation.descrip: Starts a conversation with the player.
betonquest.v2.event.conversation.optiona: Jump into a NPC option directely instead of a starting option
betonquest.v2.event.damage.description: Damages the player by specified amount of damage.
betonquest.v2.event.deletepoint.descript: Clear all player points in a specified category.
betonquest.v2.event.deleteglobalpoint.de: Removes the specified category from the global points list.
betonquest.v2.event.door.description: Opens and closes doors, trapdoors and fence gates.
betonquest.v2.event.drop.description: Drops (place) the defined items at a defined location.
betonquest.v2.event.drop.optional.locati: If empty items will be droped at the player's location
betonquest.v2.event.deleffect.descriptio: Removes the specified potion effects from the player.
betonquest.v2.event.effect.description: Adds a specified potion effect to player.
betonquest.v2.event.effect.mandatory.dur: How long the effect will last in seconds
betonquest.v2.event.effect.optional.ambi: Make potion particles appear more invisible (just like beacon effects)
betonquest.v2.event.effect.optional.noic: Hide the icon from user UI
betonquest.v2.event.experience.mandatory: amount to change depends on the Modification types

action:addExperience only adds experience points, action:addLevel adds a level and keeps the current percentage. action:setExperienceBar sets the progress of the bar with decimal values between 0 and 1. action:setLevel sets only the level.
(DEPRECATED) Add / remove levels instead of experience points
betonquest.v2.event.folder.optional.dela: The delay before the folder starts executing it's events
betonquest.v2.event.folder.optional.peri: The interval between each event of the folder
betonquest.v2.event.folder.optional.rand: Number of events to be randomly picked
betonquest.v2.event.folder.optional.canc: Terminates the remaining events execution when the player disconnected
betonquest.v2.event.first.display: If-ElseIF Through a List of Events
betonquest.v2.event.first.description:
Attempts to check each event then execute it if and only if its condition is met, starting from the first onward. It just likes `if - else if - else if ...` in any programming languages. Once an event is successfully executed, the rest of the events are skipped.
Usage examples:
{0}
betonquest.v2.event.give.optional.notify: Display a message to the player about receiving items
betonquest.v2.event.give.optional.backpa: Forces quest items to be placed in the backpack
betonquest.v2.event.givejournal.descript: Gives the player his journal. Same as /j command.
betonquest.v2.event.globalpoint.descript: Manipulates points in a global category. Same as the normal point event. These global categories are player independent.
betonquest.v2.event.globalpoint.mandator: amount to change depends on the Action types
betonquest.v2.event.globaltag.descriptio: Sets tag globally for all players.
betonquest.v2.event.hunger.description: Changes the food level of the player.
betonquest.v2.event.hunger.mandatory.amo:
For "set", the amount can be any value.
For "give" or "take", the final value will be limited between 0 and 20.
betonquest.v2.event.if.description: Checks a condition then runs the first or second event.
betonquest.v2.event.itemdurability.descr: Adds or removes durability from an item in the slot.
betonquest.v2.event.itemdurability.optio: Ignores the unbreakable flag and unbreaking enchantment
Prevent interference caused by other plugins
betonquest.v2.event.journal.description: Adds, deletes an entry to/from a player's journal, or refreshes it.
betonquest.v2.event.journal.mandatory.jo: Leave it blank if you selected "Update"
betonquest.v2.event.language.description: Changes player's language to the specified one.
betonquest.v2.event.lightning.descriptio: Strikes a lightning at given location.
betonquest.v2.event.lightning.optional.n: Strikes the lightning without any damages
betonquest.v2.event.notify.optional.cate: Will load all settings from that Notification Category
betonquest.v2.event.notifyall.descriptio: Send notifications to all online players.
betonquest.v2.event.notifyall.optional.c: Will load all settings from that Notification Category
betonquest.v2.event.log.description:
Prints a provided message to the server log.
Note that when used in static context (by schedules) replacing player dependent variables will not work as the event is player independent.
betonquest.v2.event.objective.descriptio: Adds, removes or completes the specified objective(s).
betonquest.v2.event.opsudo.description: Fires a command as the player, with temporary OP permissions.
betonquest.v2.event.party.description: Runs events on every player in the party.

betonquest.v2.event.party.optional.amoun: The maximum number of players to be selected
betonquest.v2.event.pickrandom.descripti: Pcks one (or multiple) events then runs it.
The maximum number of events to be executed
betonquest.v2.event.point.mandatory.amou: amount to change depends on the Action types
betonquest.v2.event.point.optional.notif: Display a message to the player about the change
betonquest.v2.event.removeentity.descrip: Removes or kills all mobs of given type at the location.
betonquest.v2.event.removeentity.optiona: The name of the mob which should get killed
Removes mobs that only with the same mark using the spawn mob event
betonquest.v2.event.run.description:
Specify multiple instructions in one, long instruction.
Actual instruction need to be specified, not an event name. Don't use conditions here, it behaves strangely.
betonquest.v2.event.run.mandatory.eventI: Actual instruction need to be specified, not an event name.
betonquest.v2.event.runForAll.display: Run Events for All Online Players
betonquest.v2.event.runForAll.descriptio: Runs the specified event(s) once for each player on the server.
List of Event Names to be executed
betonquest.v2.event.runForAll.optional.w: List of Condition Names to be checked on each player (not the trigger player) while executing events
betonquest.v2.event.runIndependent.displ: Run Events Player Independently / Run Events as Schedular Does
betonquest.v2.event.runIndependent.descr:
Runs the specified event(s) player independently (as if it was run from a schedule).
Note that these events behave differently when executed by this:
  • `tag delete` - deletes the tag for all players in the database (even if offline)
  • `objective remove` - removes the objective for all players in the database (even if offline)
  • `journal delete` - deletes the journal entry for all players in the database (even if offline)
  • `deletepoint` - clears points of a given category for all players in the database (even if offline)
betonquest.v2.event.runIndependent.manda: List of Event Names to be executed
betonquest.v2.event.score.mandatory.name: Name
Name of the scoreboard objective
betonquest.v2.event.score.mandatory.amou: amount to change depends on the Action types
betonquest.v2.event.setblock.description: Changes the block at the given position.
betonquest.v2.event.setblock.optional.ig: Deactivate the physics of the block
betonquest.v2.event.stage.description:
Manipulates player's stage.
Note that `set` will not automatically complete a `stage` objective. Use `increase` or `decrease` instead.
betonquest.v2.event.stage.mandatory.stag: The name of the stage objective
The name of the stage when `set`. Or amount to `increase` or `decrease`
betonquest.v2.event.spawn.description: Spawns specified amount of mobs of given type at the location.
The name of the mobs to be spawned
betonquest.v2.event.spawn.optional.marke: Add an invincible mark onto the spawned mobs
betonquest.v2.event.spawn.optional.h.too: Equip the mob with a helmet
betonquest.v2.event.spawn.optional.c.too: Equip the mob with a chestplate
betonquest.v2.event.spawn.optional.b.too: Equip the mob with a boots
betonquest.v2.event.spawn.optional.m.too: Equip the mob with an item on the main hand
betonquest.v2.event.spawn.optional.o.too: Equip the mob with an item on the off hand
betonquest.v2.event.spawn.optional.drops: Items to be dropped when killed
betonquest.v2.event.sudo.description: Fires a command as the player.
betonquest.v2.event.take.description: Removes items from the player's inventory, armor slots or backpack.
betonquest.v2.event.take.optional.invOrd: Will check these locations with order. Posible values: Backpack, Inventory, Offhand, Armor
betonquest.v2.event.take.optional.notify: Display a message to the player about loosing items
betonquest.v2.event.time.description:
Changes the time of the world.
  • `2.75` - Set to 2:45 AM
  • `+2.75` - Add 2.75 hour from now
  • `-2.75` - Subtract 2.75 hour from now
How many hours / ticks to be change. 1.5 hours = 1 hour + 30 min
The world name to be changed e.g. world
Unit in ticks instead of hours?
betonquest.v2.event.teleport.description: Teleports the player to the specified location.
betonquest.v2.event.variable.description: Changes a custom variable's value stored in a `variable` objective. Note that the player must have a `variable` objective started first for this event to have any effects.
betonquest.v2.event.variable.mandatory.v: The `variable` Objective' Name which you want to store the variable onto. You must define this Objective in you Objective list first.
betonquest.v2.event.velocity.mandatory.v: The values of the vector: (x;y;z) for absolute direction, (sideways;upwards;forwards) for relative direction
betonquest.v2.event.velocity.optional.di: Coordinate system to be used. Absolute = Coordinate fixed to the world, Relative = Fixed coordinate ralative to the player. Default to `absolute`
`relative_y` - Hrizontal Relative (Relative X & Z, Absolute Y)
betonquest.v2.event.weather.description: Sets the weather in the world the player is currently in.
betonquest.v2.event.weather.optional.dur: How long it will last, in seconds
betonquest.v2.event.weather.optional.wor: A name of the world to change weather on
betonquest.v2.condition.advancement.desc: Does the player have a specified advancement?
betonquest.v2.condition.and.description: Checks if every conditions are met.
betonquest.v2.condition.and.mandatory.co: The conditions that must be met
betonquest.v2.condition.armor.descriptio: Does the player wearing an specified armor?
betonquest.v2.condition.biome.descriptio: Does the player inside a specific biome?
betonquest.v2.condition.check.descriptio: Define list of specific conditions, and check if the are all met.
betonquest.v2.condition.chestitem.descri: Does a chest have specific items?
betonquest.v2.condition.conversation.des: Does the player could begin a specified conversation? It checks the conversation's starting options to see if any of them return true.
betonquest.v2.condition.effect.descripti: Does the player has an active potion effect?
betonquest.v2.condition.empty.descriptio: Does the player's inventory have enough empty slots?
betonquest.v2.condition.empty.optional.e: The player should have exact number of slots and no more
betonquest.v2.condition.entities.descrip: Are there any specified amount of mobs in an area?
betonquest.v2.condition.entities.mandato: A radius around location where the mobs must be
betonquest.v2.condition.entities.optiona: Should the mobs have the same mark from the spawn mob event?
betonquest.v2.condition.experience.descr: Does the player have the specified amount of experience levels?
betonquest.v2.condition.facing.descripti: Where does the player is looking at?
betonquest.v2.condition.facing.mandatory: Up and down start at a pitch of 60°
betonquest.v2.condition.gamemode.descrip: Is the the player in a specified game mode?
betonquest.v2.condition.gamemode.mandato: What game mode the player should be?
betonquest.v2.condition.globalpoint.desc: Is the global point equal or greater than a specified value?
betonquest.v2.condition.globalpoint.mand: The name of a Global Point
betonquest.v2.condition.globalpoint.opti: The Global Point should have exact number of points and no more
betonquest.v2.condition.hand.description: Is the player holding a specific item on hand?
betonquest.v2.condition.health.descripti: Does the player have equal or more health than specified amount?
betonquest.v2.condition.health.mandatory: Health level could be a decimal
betonquest.v2.condition.height.descripti: Does the player stand BELOW specific height?
betonquest.v2.condition.height.mandatory: Height Y could be a decimal
betonquest.v2.condition.hunger.descripti: Does the player have equal or more specified Hunger Level? Note that the player can not sprint if the hunger level is below 7.
betonquest.v2.condition.hunger.mandatory: Hunger Level could be a decimal
betonquest.v2.condition.inconversation.d: Is the player in a conversation?
betonquest.v2.condition.item.description: Does the player have all the specified items in inventory?
betonquest.v2.condition.itemdurability.d: Does the player possess a certain amount of durability on an item? Will return false if the item does not have durability. e.g. stone, stick.
betonquest.v2.condition.itemdurability.o: Define the durability above on a 0.0 to 1.0 scale? Instead of a real value, you can define 0.0 as completely broken, 1.0 as maximun durability.
betonquest.v2.condition.journal.descript: Does the player have a specified entry in his/her journal?
betonquest.v2.condition.journal.mandator: An internal name of the entry defined in the `journal` section
betonquest.v2.condition.language.descrip: Does the player has one of the specified languages selected as their quest language?
betonquest.v2.condition.location.descrip: Does the player stand within a specified location?
betonquest.v2.condition.looking.descript: Does the player looking at a block? You must specified either a Location or Type of Block.
betonquest.v2.condition.looking.optional: The target block is not allowed to have more BlockStates than specified
betonquest.v2.condition.mooncycle.descri: Is the phase of the moon the same as specified?
betonquest.v2.condition.numbercompare.de: Is one number greater / less / equals to another?
betonquest.v2.condition.objective.descri: Does the player have an active objective?
betonquest.v2.condition.or.description: Checks if any one condition is met.
betonquest.v2.condition.partialdate.desc: Does the current date match a given pattern?
betonquest.v2.condition.partialdate.opti: The day of the month, e.g. 2 means 2nd of every month
The month of the year, e.g. 2-4 means from February to April
The coverage distance from the player whom triggers this condition
Party member will be selected with these conditions
betonquest.v2.condition.party.optional.e: The conditions that must be met by all party members
betonquest.v2.condition.party.optional.a: The conditions that only need to be met by one party member
betonquest.v2.condition.party.optional.c: Minimun amount of members in the party
betonquest.v2.condition.permission.descr: Does the player have a specific permission node?
betonquest.v2.condition.point.descriptio: Does the player have enough points?
betonquest.v2.condition.point.optional.e: The player should have exact number of points and no more
betonquest.v2.condition.ride.description: Is the player riding an entity?
betonquest.v2.condition.random.mandatory: e.g. 12-100 means 12 out of 100 times return true
betonquest.v2.condition.rating.descripti: Is the armor have enough protection (armor icons) the plaryer wearing?
betonquest.v2.condition.rating.mandatory: Increament by 1, equals to 0.5 armor icon in-game
betonquest.v2.condition.realtime.descrip: Is the current real-world's time within a range?
betonquest.v2.condition.score.descriptio: Does the playe gained enough score in a specified objective on a scoreboard?
betonquest.v2.condition.stage.descriptio: Compares the players current stage with the given stage by its index numbers.
The name of a stage Objective
betonquest.v2.condition.tag.description: Does the player have a specified tag?
betonquest.v2.condition.testforblock.des: Is there a specific block on a location?
betonquest.v2.condition.testforblock.opt: The target block is not allowed to have more BlockStates than specified
betonquest.v2.condition.time.description: Is the in-game time within a specific range?
betonquest.v2.condition.variable.descrip: Is a variable match a regular expression?
betonquest.v2.condition.variable.optiona: Force the checking to be run on the main thread? It causes preformance penalty if turned on. This is only required by some third-party pluings.
betonquest.v2.condition.weather.descript: Is the weather matched? Note that you need to use `/weather` to change the weather for this to take effects, NOT `/toggledownfall`.
betonquest.v2.condition.world.descriptio: Is the player staying in a specified world?
betonquest.v2.objective.*.optional.event: Events to be run if this objective is fulfilled
betonquest.v2.objective.action.descripti: Completes when the player clicks on the given block type.
The target block is not allowed to have more BlockStates than specified
Should the clikc, e.g. left click hit mobs, be cancelled?
betonquest.v2.objective.arrow.descriptio: The player needs to shoot an arrow into the target.
A radius around location where the arrow must land, should be small
betonquest.v2.objective.block.descriptio: The player must break or place the specified amount of blocks.
betonquest.v2.objective.block.optional.e: The target block is not allowed to have more BlockStates than specified
betonquest.v2.objective.block.optional.n: Disable cheat checking. It will counts the blocks the player placed themself.
Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.breed.descriptio: The player must breed a type of animals for certain amounts.
betonquest.v2.objective.breed.optional.n: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.chestput.descrip: The player must put the specified items in a specified chest.
betonquest.v2.objective.chestput.optiona: Do not remove the items from chest when objective completed
Allow multiple players open the chest at the same time
betonquest.v2.objective.consume.descript: The player must eat the specified foods, or drink the specified potion.
betonquest.v2.objective.consume.optional: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.craft.descriptio: The player must craft specified items.
betonquest.v2.objective.craft.optional.n: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.enchant.descript: The player must enchant the specified quest item with a specified enchantment.
betonquest.v2.objective.enchant.optional: Should all or only one enchantment need to be completed
Number of items to be enchanted
Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.experience.descr: The player must reach the specified amount of experience levels.
betonquest.v2.objective.experience.optio: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.delay.descriptio: The player must wait for certain amount of time, including offline. Unit defaults to "minutes".
betonquest.v2.objective.delay.optional.i: The interval in which the objective checks if the time is up. Measured in ticks. Low values cost more performance but make the objective preciser.
betonquest.v2.objective.die.description: The player must die with conditions.
betonquest.v2.objective.fish.description: The player must catch something with the fishing rod. The "fish" could be any item.
betonquest.v2.objective.fish.mandatory.i: The item that must be caught
betonquest.v2.objective.fish.optional.ho: Where the hook needs to be
betonquest.v2.objective.fish.optional.ra: A radius around the hook's landing
betonquest.v2.objective.fish.optional.no: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.interact.descrip: The player must click on an entity.
betonquest.v2.objective.interact.mandato: How many UNIQUE mobs that need to be cliked (not the same mob)
betonquest.v2.objective.interact.optiona: The name of the mob to be clicked
If the mob is a player, the real name of the player to be clicked
Should the mobs have the same mark as when spawned with a spawn mob event?
Should the clikc, e.g. left click hit mobs, be cancelled?
Where the click should be happened
Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.kill.description: The player needs to kill another players.
betonquest.v2.objective.kill.mandatory.a: How many players that need to be killed
betonquest.v2.objective.kill.optional.na: The name of the player to be killed
betonquest.v2.objective.kill.optional.re: Conditions that need to be satisfied by the players whom are going to be killed, e.g. tag_team_b
betonquest.v2.objective.kill.optional.no: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.location.descrip: The player must move into a specified range of a location.
betonquest.v2.objective.location.mandato: A radius around location where the player must be
betonquest.v2.objective.login.descriptio: The player simply needs to login to the server.
betonquest.v2.objective.logout.descripti: The player simply needs to leave the server.
betonquest.v2.objective.password.descrip:
The player has to write a certain password in chat.
This is what the player has to type in chat:
Solution: The Cake is a lie!
betonquest.v2.objective.password.optiona: List of events to be executed when password incorrect
betonquest.v2.objective.pickup.descripti: The player needs to pickup the specified amount of items.
Number of items to be picked up, in total.
Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.mobkill.descript: The player must kill the specified amount of entities.
betonquest.v2.objective.mobkill.mandator: Number of mobs to be killed
betonquest.v2.objective.mobkill.optional: The name of the mob to be killed
Should the mobs have the same mark from the spawn mob event?
Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.brew.description: The player needs to brew specified amount of specified potions.
betonquest.v2.objective.brew.optional.no: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.shear.descriptio: The player has to shear specified amount of sheep.
betonquest.v2.objective.shear.optional.n: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.smelt.descriptio: The player must smelt the specified item.
Number of items to be smelt
betonquest.v2.objective.smelt.optional.n: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.stage.descriptio:
The player must complete the specified stages.
You can modify the stages with the `stage` event and check it with the `stage` condition.
The stages that must be completed
betonquest.v2.objective.stage.optional.p: Make this objective must be completed by `objective` event. Prevents it from being completed by increasing the stage.
betonquest.v2.objective.step.description: The player has to step on a pressure plate at a given location. The type of plate does not matter.
betonquest.v2.objective.tame.description: The player must tame some amount of mobs.
betonquest.v2.objective.tame.optional.no: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.jump.description:
The player must jump.
This feature requires Paper.
betonquest.v2.objective.jump.optional.no: Displays messages to the player each time they progress the objective, with interval
betonquest.v2.objective.ride.description: The player must ride a specific entitiy
betonquest.v2.objective.command.descript: The player must execute a specified command.
betonquest.v2.objective.command.optional: Match everything till the end, not just the begining
Prevent the command from being executed. Useful when the command is not exist.
List of events to be executed when command does not match
betonquest.v2.objective.equip.descriptio:
The player must equip the specified quest item in the specified slot.
This feature requires Paper.
betonquest.v2.objective.variable.descrip:
Stores custom variables. It also allows the player to set custom variables typed in chat with format "key: value".
For more details, please refer to the documentation.
betonquest.v2.objective.variable.optiona: Prevent players from changing variables through chat. All variales must be changed with a `variable` Event.
